title: SCOTUS student loan ruling could be headwind against economic recovery: Economists
description: The Supreme Court’s student loans ruling could cost billions in economic impact, according to some analysts.

title: WATCH:  Rehabilitated sea turtle returns to ocean
description: Well-wishers clapped and cheered as Sweet Potato, a 103-pound loggerhead sea turtle, was released into the ocean after being treated for a flipper injury.

title: Virginia admissions case could be legal follow-up to affirmative action ruling

title: Fox News settles lawsuits brought by former employee for $12M
description: Fox News has settled two lawsuits brought by a former employee for $12 million, according to a statement issued on Friday by the employee's attorney.

title: Apple is close to becoming the first public company valued at $3 trillion

title: In letter to lawmaker, Hunter Biden's lawyer slams IRS whistleblower as 'disgruntled'
description: Hunter Biden's lawyer has sent a letter to a GOP lawmaker condemning an IRS whistleblower who accused DOJ officials of undermining the probe into the president's son.

title: Biden says 'fight is not over' after SCOTUS rejects student loan forgiveness program
description: "I believe that the Court’s decision to strike down our student debt relief plan is wrong," Biden said in his first reaction to the ruling.

title: A bobcat attacks a camper sleeping in a hammock at a Connecticut state park
description: A camper sleeping in a hammock at a Connecticut state park was attacked by a bobcat

title: 'Rust' armorer accused of handing off bag of cocaine after deadly on-set shooting
description: Hannah Gutierrez-Reed was charged with two counts of involuntary manslaughter in the death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins, as well as tampering with evidence.

title: WATCH:  Dog loves to clean up litter
description: This 5-year-old border collie goes on regular walks with her owner to pick up trash.

title: Actor Alan Arkin dead at 89
description: Alan Arkin, an Oscar-winning actor known for his roles in "Little Miss Sunshine," "Argo" and "The Kominsky Method," has died at age 89.

title: FBI Director Wray deposed in suit over FBI agent's firing; Trump could be next
description: FBI director Chris Wray has been deposed by lawyers for two ex-FBI employees who are suing over their departures, which followed public ridicule by then-President Trump.

title: Supreme Court strikes down Biden student loan debt forgiveness program
description: The program would have benefited 43 million Americans at a cost of $400 billion.

title: Indiana Supreme Court upholds abortion ban
description: The Indiana Supreme Court has decided that the state’s abortion ban doesn’t violate Indiana's constitution

title: 'Watermelon snow' piques curiosities in Utah after abnormally wet winter
description: The presence of pinkish snow in the Rocky Mountains is piquing the curiosities of hikers, campers and photo-seekers this summer and raising a host of questions about nature, health and climate

title: Child who fell overboard from ferry and mother who jumped in afterward are dead
description: Polish police say a 7-year-old child who fell overboard from a passenger ferry in the Baltic Sea and his mother, who jumped into the water after him, are both dead

title: Ghislaine Maxwell's conviction should stand, prosecutors say
description: Prosecutors urged a federal appeals court to uphold the conviction of Ghislaine Maxwell, who was found guilty of trafficking women and girls for Jeffrey Epstein.

title: 'It's gonna be very bloody': How war in Ukraine could come to an end

description: The United States has flown nuclear-capable bombers to the Korean Peninsula in its latest show of force against North Korea

title: Santos set for 1st court appearance after pleading not guilty to 13 counts
description: Embattled Rep. George Santos is set to appear in court Friday in his first court appearance since pleading not guilty last month to fraud and other charges.

title: FBI creates a national database to track swatting
description:
As swatting incidents around the country increase, the FBI has created a national database to track them, according to new information from the law enforcement agency.

"In response to the national call on swatting, the FBI initiated the Virtual Command Center (VCC) known as the National Common Operation Picture (NCOP),” the FBI said in a statement to ABC News.


Swatting, as it is commonly called is when a prank call is placed, usually saying there is some sort of active shooter or immediate dangerous situation, with the hopes to illicit a large police response which often includes the arrival of a SWAT team.

Celebrities like Justin Bieber, Rihanna and Tom Cruise have all been victims of swatting.

The new database is a "collaborative effort between the FBI and law enforcement partners to track and create a real-time picture of swatting incidents," the FBI says.

Since its inception in May 2023, the database has already tracked 129 swatting incidents around the country.

title: Man accused of plotting antisemitic attack indicted by grand jury
description: Seann Pietila, the 19-year-old who allegedly subscribed to a neo-Nazi ideology, was indicted by a grand jury.

title: WATCH:  Labrador retriever has a knack for finding lost frisbees
description: The four-year-old pup, Daisy, has found 155 frisbees and counting at a West Virginia park.
